Dialogue.NPCText:
You see a stooped man in a tattered monk’s robe, swirling watered wine in a battered tin cup. Shadows cling to his sunken eyes, and his fingers trace a faded sigil of Yew in the dust on the table.

He looks up with a tired smile. “Ah. Another soul seeking warmth in cold Eldermoor. They call me Brother Falin, once of Yew… though here, I am little more than a ghost in exile.”

Option.text: You were a monk of Yew? What brings you here?
What do you seek in Eldermoor, Brother?
You look troubled. Is something wrong?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Falin’s gaze turns inward.
“I tended the Shrine of Justice once. Then… shadows fell. I saw things that broke my vows—broken oaths, broken seals, broken minds. They say I fled. Perhaps they are right. Here, in Eldermoor, I serve in silence and try not to remember.”

He smiles, sad and wry.
“I seek peace, and find only echoes. The villagers let me warm their benches so long as I keep my tales short and my wine weaker than Brenvar’s wit. Sometimes I help Edda gather herbs, or listen to Mira’s dreams. But peace… it’s a rare coin these days.”

Option.text: You’re a friend of Edda and Mira?
If there’s trouble, maybe I can help.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Falin winces, as if the question pains him.
“There is an ogre—no, a thing that wears an ogre’s shape. They call it the Necrotic Ogre, but I fear it is no mere beast. I sense… corruption, as I once did at the shrine. It haunts the night beyond Edda’s fields, scaring children and slaughtering cattle. Mayor Halric says to hunt it. Edda whispers it carries sickness on its claws. I drink, and pray it will move on. But it lingers.”

Option.text: I’ll hunt the Necrotic Ogre for you.
Is it truly cursed, or just an ogre?
Why do you fear it so?

Dialogue.NPCText:
His hand trembles, spilling wine.
“The shrine was… violated. Its seal, ancient and delicate, was broken. I remember chanting, candlelight, a shadow deeper than the night. Minax’s voice, sweet as poison, echoing in my mind. I… fled, and the land grew bitter behind me. That is all I can say.”

His voice drops. “Some burdens are best left unshared.”

Option.text: If you ever wish to return, I will help you.
That must weigh heavy on your soul.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He looks at you, hope flickering in his gaze.
“Would you? There are few in Eldermoor I trust. If you’d stand with me, perhaps we could cleanse what was broken. But first, the darkness must be thinned—begin with the ogre, and perhaps the path home will open.”

Option.text: Tell me more about this ogre.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Yew is never truly lost, nor the Virtues. But the shrine… it is sealed by old magic, and guarded by things I once called friends. I would not ask anyone to face it until the corruption here is driven out. The ogre is a symptom. Heal the wound, then cleanse the shrine.”

Option.text: I’ll handle the ogre for you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He gives a thin smile.
“You have the eyes of a confessor. Yes, it weighs on me. But hope flickers even in darkness, yes? I see it in Mira’s laughter, in Edda’s stubborn kindness. And in strangers willing to face monsters for those in need.”

“Edda is wise—some say half-witch, but I know her as healer. Mira is light in a heavy world, though her feet ache to roam. I trust them more than I trust Halric’s stubborn pride. Here, one must earn trust sip by sip, not in grand gestures.”

Option.text: Edda sent me to check on you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He chuckles softly.
“She’s a thorn, that one, but her heart’s true. She brings me wild herbs to ease my dreams. If she trusts you, then so do I—at least a little.”

Option.text: I want to help the village.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Brenvar would chase off the sun if he thought it’d steal Mira from his inn. She deserves the world, not just muddy floors and stale ale. Still, Eldermoor needs its laughter.”

“There is a creature—the Necrotic Ogre—skulking in the hollow north of the marsh. Some say it was once a simple brute, but Minax’s shadow twists all it touches. Its hide rots and writhes, its breath withers grass. I have seen it watching from the treeline. Will you drive it out?”

“This ogre—Necrotic, they call it—bears wounds that never heal. Maggots squirm beneath its flesh, and its eyes burn with green fire. Some whisper it feeds on sorrow and fear. It has crushed livestock, torn fences, and left poison in its wake. Edda says the land sours where it walks. Halric wants it gone, but even Aldric keeps his distance. I… I sense a shadow on it, a shadow I have met before.”

Option.text: I’ll destroy the creature for Eldermoor.
Sounds grim. I need to think.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He hesitates, voice a whisper.
“Because I know the darkness that stirs within it. It calls to those who have tasted despair. I… am not as strong as I once was. But perhaps you are.”

“Perhaps all things can be redeemed. But this beast… its pain is bound to Minax’s magic. If you find a token or charm clutched in its hand, bring it to Priestess Miralda before burning it. She will know if redemption is possible—or if the darkness must be put to rest.”

Falin’s haunted eyes steady.
“The ogre lairs in the sunken hollow, north of Edda’s marsh. Hunt it by dusk, when its strength wanes. If you return with proof—a rotted claw or its shrunken skull—I will share what I know of the shrine’s fate… and perhaps, together, we may find redemption for more than just Eldermoor.”

Option.text: I will bring you proof of its demise.
Tell me more about what happened in Yew.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Thank you, friend. Remember—do not touch the ogre’s wounds with bare flesh. And if you see strange runes or tokens on its body, bring them to Miralda or Edda. Return safe, and perhaps I will have the courage to return with you to Yew, and face what I have fled.”
